data.definition: Anemia is a condition in which there is a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood. Iron deficiency anemia is the most common type. The primary causes of anemia include blood loss, failure of the bone marrow to produce sufficient red blood cells or premature destruction of red blood cells.
underwriting_focus: Full details of doctors providing treatment and any referrals
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement, contingent on type

data.definition: Aneurysm is a localized enlargement and/or dilation of an artery caused by weakness in the arterial wall.
underwriting_focus: Full details of doctors providing treatment and any referrals
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

life.general_guideline: Contingent on type, location, size and date of aneurysm. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline

data.definition: Anxiety is a feeling of apprehension or fear that lingers and can be situational or chronic. A generalized anxiety disorder is a relatively common condition with symptoms of excessive worry or anxiety of at least six months duration. It may include restlessness, fatigue, poor concentration, sleep disturbance, and more.
underwriting_focus: Dates of onset, diagnosis and duration
Any loss of time from work
requirements: Mental Health Questionnaire
Attending Physician’s Statement, contingent on severity

life.otherwise: Ranges from a rating to decline

data.definition: Asthma is characterized by recurrent attacks of shortness of breath and wheezing due to a reversible narrowing of the smaller bronchi and bronchioles. Most cases are triggered by allergens or irritants and are more common in children and young adults.
requirements: Respiratory Disorder Questionnaire

data.definition: Atrial fibrillation (A Fib or AF) is a quivering or irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) that can lead to blood clots, stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.
underwriting_focus: Date atrial fibrillation/flutter was diagnosed and age of onset
Type of investigations/treatment (including medication and dosage)
Full details of doctors providing treatment and any referrals
Any associated conditions and/or heart disease
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

life.most_favorable: Less than four attacks per year, no underlying conditions: standard to 150%

data.definition: Bariatric surgery is performed on the stomach or intestine to induce weight loss. Also known as stomach stapling, gastric bypass surgery, or gastric banding.
underwriting_focus: Any associated conditions (e.g., diabetes, hypertension, coronary disease)
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

life.additional_rating: May apply depending on current build (height/weight)
life.recent_surgery: Surgery within the last six months: postpone or decline

data.definition: Barrett’s esophagus (BE) is a disorder in which the lining of the esophagus is damaged by stomach acid, increasing the risk for esophageal cancer.
underwriting_focus: Type and results of all testing completed (including biopsy)
Compliance with treatment and follow-up surveillance
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

life.most_favorable: Biopsy and regular surveillance: standard to 150%
life.severe_case: High or unknown degree of dysplasia: postpone or decline

data.definition: Cancer, or malignant neoplasm, is a broad group of diseases involving unregulated cell growth. Cancer cells grow uncontrollably and may spread through the lymphatic system or bloodstream. There are over 200 different types of cancer. The causes are diverse, and remission does not always guarantee standard consideration.
underwriting_focus: Frequency of follow-ups or any planned follow-up
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including pathology reports, staging, treatment history, and current status)

note: Applicants within one year of diagnosis: usually postpone
life.general: Contingent on staging, severity, results of treatment and recurrence. Possible range from standard to rating to decline.

data.definition: Breast cancer is a malignant tumor that starts in the cells of the breast. It is the most common form of cancer among Canadian women.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including pathology reports, staging, treatment history, and current status)

life.general: Contingent on type and stage of breast cancer, time since treatment ended, and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to rating to decline.
life.rating: May be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Colorectal cancer is a malignant tumor that can affect any part of the large bowel and is one of the most common cancers worldwide.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on age of applicant, type and stage of colorectal cancer, lymph node involvement, time since treatment ended, and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specific period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Leukemia is a cancer of the blood or bone marrow which can be chronic or acute.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on type and stage of leukemia, time since treatment ended, and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline (stages 2, 3 and 4: decline).
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specific period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Lung cancer is a malignant tumor that starts in the cells of the lung and is the leading cause of cancer death in both men and women. There is a strong association between lung cancer and smoking.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on age of applicant, type and stage of lung cancer, any lymph node involvement, time since treatment ended and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Malignant melanoma is the most aggressive type of skin cancer that develops from the pigment-containing cells known as melanocytes.
underwriting_focus: Frequency of follow-ups or any planned follow-up
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on type and stage of melanoma, any lymph node involvement, length of time since treatment ended and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Prostate cancer is usually a slow growing tumor and one of the most common forms of cancer in males.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history, current status and current PSA result)
Blood profile to include PSA and urinalysis

life.general: Contingent on age of applicant, type and stage of prostate cancer, any lymph node involvement, length of time since treatment ended and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.disease_name: Cancer – Skin Tumors Other Than Malignant Melanoma
data.definition: Skin tumors are abnormal cells that arise from the skin and have the ability to spread to other parts of the body. This includes basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and dysplastic nevus and lentigo maligna.
underwriting_focus: Frequency of follow-ups or any planned follow-up
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on stage of cancer, severity, number of lesions, results of treatment and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: Thyroid cancer is abnormal cell growth within the thyroid gland. Thyroid tumors may also be referred to as 'nodules'. Papillary and follicular are the most common types of thyroid cancer.
underwriting_focus: Type of treatment and date completed
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including initial pathology reports, staging/extent of disease and treatment, interim history and current status)

life.general: Contingent on age of applicant, type and stage of thyroid cancer, length of time since treatment ended and any recurrence. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Rating can be a percentage or flat extra for a specified period of time from the number of years since treatment ended, or a combination of both.

data.definition: COPD is a term used to describe a variety of diseases that cause significant chronic, irreversible or frequent airway obstruction. Two common forms of COPD are chronic bronchitis and emphysema.
underwriting_focus: Smoking history and current tobacco use
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

data.definition: Congenital heart defects are problems with the heart’s structure that are present at birth. They can vary significantly in severity.
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including all cardiac test results)

life.general: Contingent on type of congenital defect, details of any surgery, treatment and medication. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.

data.definition: Coronary artery disease occurs when the coronary arteries are unable to supply sufficient blood to the heart due to a narrowing of the arteries caused by fatty material and plaque buildup.
underwriting_focus: Any associated medical impairments (such as hypertension, diabetes or hyperlipidemia)
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (including all cardiac test results)

life.general: Contingent on the number of vessels involved, severity of the disease, type of treatment and any associated risk factors. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.
life.note: Unable to consider for coverage within six months of diagnosis.

data.definition: Crohn’s disease is a chronic inflammatory disease usually affecting the terminal ileum (ileitis, enteritis) and/or colon (colitis). Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) refers to chronic intestinal inflammation of an unknown cause, commonly applied to Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis.
underwriting_focus: Frequency and dates of previous episodes
requirements: Possibly an Attending Physician’s Statement with all clinical notes, test results and referral reports

life.general: Contingent on the severity of symptoms, treatment and additional complications. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.

data.definition: Major depression is characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, worthlessness, rejection, loss of hope, and loss of interest in usual activities. It can occur as a single episode or be recurrent, and is often classified as dysthymic mood, major depression, or anhedonia.
underwriting_focus: Frequency and dates of previous episodes
Full details of doctors providing treatment and any referrals
Any loss of time from work
requirements: Mental Health Questionnaire
Attending Physician’s Statement (from attending physician and specialist)

life.general: Contingent on the number of episodes, contributing factors and current treatment. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.

data.definition: Diabetes is a lifelong disease of high blood sugar caused by too little insulin, resistance to insulin, or both. The three main types of diabetes are type 1, type 2, and gestational.
requirements: Diabetes Questionnaire (if applicable)
Attending Physician’s Statement
Blood profile and urinalysis

underwriting_action.life: Contingent on type of diabetes, control, treatment, complications, and any associated risk factors. Possible range from standard to a rating to decline.

data.definition: Use of habit-forming drugs for non-medical purposes. Includes use of illegal or prescription drugs in excess or unintended ways.
underwriting_focus: Treatment (medication, participation in self-help group, admission or referral to treatment program)

Attending Physician’s Statement
Blood profile and urinalysis
Motor Vehicle Record, if appropriate

data.definition: Epilepsy is a disorder of the central nervous system characterized by seizures due to excessive discharge of neurons. It may start in childhood or be secondary to other underlying brain diseases.
underwriting_focus: Frequency and dates of previous seizures
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement (contingent on severity)

life.best_case: Petit mal: may be standard or rated depending on frequency and time since last attack
life.otherwise: Grand mal: likely highly substandard, if not declined

critical_illness.best_case: Petit mal with long remission and no underlying disease
critical_illness.otherwise: Decline if associated with brain disease or grand mal

data.definition: Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver, commonly caused by viruses or toxins such as alcohol or certain drugs.
underwriting_focus: Type of hepatitis and date of diagnosis
History of any intravenous drug use
requirements: Blood profile (routine with current hepatitis)
Attending Physician’s Statement (possibly required, with follow-up test results)

life.otherwise: Contingent on symptoms, treatment, and associated medical impairments — range from standard to decline

critical_illness.best_case: Stable recovery with normal liver function
critical_illness.otherwise: Severe or chronic types with complications: decline

data.definition: A condition where a person has consistently higher-than-normal blood pressure. Readings above 140 systolic and 90 diastolic are generally considered significant.
requirements: Vitals (average blood pressure reading), depending on history

life.best_case: Well controlled, with one or two medications: standard
life.otherwise: Not well controlled: from a rating to decline

critical_illness.otherwise: Decline if poorly controlled or with end-organ damage

data.disease_name: Myocardial Infarction / Heart Attack / Coronary Thrombosis
data.definition: Permanent damage of a portion of the heart muscle due to inadequate oxygen supply and coronary blood flow.

life.best_case: Standard to rated depending on severity and recovery
otherwise: No consideration within 6 months of diagnosis or surgery

critical_illness.best_case: Post 6-month stable recovery with no complications
critical_illness.otherwise: Decline if early onset or ongoing symptoms

data.definition: Obesity is defined as having a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 30 or higher. It is a major health concern due to excess body fat and associated medical complications.
underwriting_focus: Treatment (surgery or medications used for weight loss or control)
requirements: Vitals
Possibly an Attending Physician’s Statement, depending on history

life.otherwise: From a rating to decline depending on level of obesity and associated conditions

critical_illness.best_case: Standard for mild obesity with no complications

data.definition: Applies to individuals awaiting surgery. Depending on the type and seriousness of the surgery, offers can range from standard to postponed.

life.best_case: Standard for minor or routine surgeries (e.g., dental, cosmetic, C-section, hemorrhoidectomy)
life.otherwise: Postpone if the surgery is major or exploratory

critical_illness.best_case: Standard only if surgery is minor and unrelated to critical systems
critical_illness.otherwise: Usually postponed until surgery and recovery complete

data.definition: Pregnancy in normal healthy women carries minimal mortality risk, and most life insurance applications can be accepted at standard rates.
underwriting_focus: Associated medical impairments (e.g., high blood pressure, hyperlipidemia, diabetes)
requirements: Possibly an Attending Physician’s Statement (depending on history)

data.definition: A disorder characterized by the cessation of breathing during sleep, commonly linked to obesity and upper airway abnormalities. Symptoms include cognitive dysfunction, personality change, and daytime sleepiness.
requirements: Possibly an Attending Physician’s Statement (depending on history)

underwriting_action.life: Depending on severity of symptoms: Standard to rating to decline

data.definition: A stroke occurs when a blood vessel that carries oxygen and nutrients to the brain is either interrupted or reduced, with symptoms lasting 24 hours or longer.
underwriting_focus: Associated medical impairments (e.g., hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia)
requirements: Attending Physician’s Statement

data.definition: TIA is a neurological event with signs and symptoms of a stroke lasting less than 24 hours.
underwriting_focus: Associated medical impairments (e.g., hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia)
